title: Johns Gospel
intro: We're going to be reading the Gospel (which means "Good News") written by a man called John in the first century. He calls Jesus "the Word"

reading.text: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was fully God. The Word was with God in the beginning. All things were created by him, and apart from him not one thing was created that has been created. In him was life, and the life was the light of mankind. And the light shines on in the darkness, but the darkness has not mastered it. A man came, sent from God, whose name was John. He came as a witness to testify about the light, so that everyone might believe through him. He himself was not the light, but he came to testify about the light. The true light, who gives light to everyone, was coming into the world. He was in the world, and the world was created by him, but the world did not recognize him.

1.title:
In the beginning...

Genesis Chapter 1 verse 1-4
1.text:
These words are used at the start of the Bible where it describes how God created everything

In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth. Now the earth was without shape and empty, and darkness was over the surface of the watery deep, but the Spirit of God was moving over the surface of the water. God said, "Let there be light." And there was light!

2.title:
John the Baptist

Matthew Chapter 1 verse 1-4
2.text:
This John isn't the man who wrote this book, but John the Baptist

In those days John the Baptist came into the wilderness of Judea proclaiming, "Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is near." 3 For he is the one about whom Isaiah the prophet had spoken: "The voice of one shouting in the wilderness, ‘Prepare the way for the Lord, make his paths straight.’" Now John wore clothing made from camel’s hair with a leather belt around his waist, and his diet consisted of locusts and wild honey.

question: What did you learn about Jesus in this passage? Did anything surprise you?
pray:
Jesus, thank you that you were there at the beginning of creation, that your light shines in through all the darkness of this world and cannot be overcome by it.

Thank you that you came to earth so that we can see more of God the Father, and know more of your grace and your truth.
outro:
Day one is complete!

Tomorrow you’ll be continuing in John’s Gospel looking at what happen when John met Jesus at the river side.
